recent_facts: Vane challenged Artie to a System Duel in an Oakhaven alley.
Artie used the 'Prop' status of his sword to invalidate the duel parameters.
Artie used the Participation Trophy to summon Level 4 Alley Rats as a distraction.
Artie discarded the Participation Trophy and fled into the backstreets.
Vane has sworn a vendetta against Artie.

last_scene: Artie was intercepted by the high-level Paladin Vane, who attempted to force him into a System Duel to test his 'Anomaly' status.
Artie successfully argued that his prop sword made the duel invalid, then used his Participation Trophy to lure a swarm of rats as a distraction.
After throwing the trophy to Vane and escaping, Artie is now hiding in the backstreets of Oakhaven with a new powerful enemy.
story_so_far: Vane challenged Artie to a Friendly Duel with a 100 Gold stake.
Artie used the 'Prop' tag on his sword to trigger a System Warning and invalidate the duel.
The Participation Trophy's Aggro Aura summoned a swarm of Level 4 Alley Rats.
Artie discarded the Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition) to distract Vane and facilitate his escape.
The System initiated the 'Vane Vendetta' thread following Artie's escape.
Artie reached safety in the backstreets with 5 Stamina remaining.

Artie entered the Gilded Tankard while carrying the Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition) in his left hand.
The trophy's Aggro Aura attracted a Level 1 Tavern Rat, which Artie killed with a 999-damage critical hit.
Mayor Whitlock explained the Crit-Economy, where Essence Shards are minted from the 'Excessive Force' of critical hits.
The Mayor attempted to recruit Artie as a 'Crit-Battery' to generate wealth in a secure vault.
Artie refused to allocate his 5 unspent stat points despite the Mayor's pressure.
Artie fled the Gilded Tankard to avoid being scouted as a political and economic resource.
